title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - ISAF Deployment Enhancement

description.narrative: The objective of this program is to improve Estonian forces command and control capabilities as well as survivability and tactical effectiveness during military assistance and Special Operations missions in Afghanistan in support of the ISAF mission. Equipment provided includes communications equipment, thermal imaging and night vision devices, and counter-IED equipment. Recipient units will be two Estonian Infantry Companies from Scouts Battalion and two teams from Estonian Special Forces Battalion.

title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Defense League Border Security Capability

description.narrative: To conduct or support programs providing training and equipment to national security forces of foreign countries for the purpose of building capacity of partner nations. The Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) provides program management. Country teams work through DoD geographic Combatant Commands (COCOMs).

description.narrative: The Ministry of Defense Advisors (MoDA) program partners senior Department of Defense (DoD) civilian experts with foreign counterparts to improve ministerial capacity. title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Special Operations Forces Development (2282 T2)

description.narrative: This program provides Estonian SOF with articles and services in order to increase interoperability with U.S. forces and increase overall night operatonal effectiveness and force protection. This program requires a DTSA waiver for thermal imagers.
